config_description: Enables scripted UDFs (JavaScript UDFs). Java UDFs are always enabled, if enable_user_defined_functions is true. Enable this option to be able to use UDFs with "language javascript" or any custom JSR-223 provider. This option has no effect, if enable_user_defined_functions is false.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' is checked in the assertUdfsEnabled method to ensure that scripted user-defined functions are enabled in cassandra.yaml. If the configuration is not enabled, an InvalidRequestException is thrown.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' configuration depends on how often the assertUdfsEnabled method is called in the system. This would typically happen when user-defined functions are being used in queries that require scripted UDFs.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: Enabling the 'enable_scripted_user_defined_functions' configuration allows the system to use scripted user-defined functions in addition to Java UDFs. This can provide more flexibility in writing custom functions for queries, but it also introduces security risks that need to be considered.
